categories.name: Elections
categories.description: Electoral process integrity, voter access protections, constitutional compliance

rubric.1-2: Normal democratic activity, minor procedural disputes
rubric.3-4: Elevated litigation, some restrictive laws passed
rubric.5-6: Significant restrictions enacted, credible interference allegations
rubric.7-8: Systematic disenfranchisement efforts, defiance of election outcomes
rubric.9-10: Overt attempts to overturn results, term limit violations

categories.name: Rule of Law
categories.description: Judicial independence, constitutional adherence, equal application of law

rubric.1-2: Strong judicial independence, consistent constitutional interpretation
rubric.3-4: Politicization of judicial appointments, selective enforcement concerns
rubric.5-6: Court packing attempts, significant constitutional challenges ignored
rubric.7-8: Judicial decisions routinely defied, pardons used to obstruct justice
rubric.9-10: Complete breakdown of judicial independence, rule by decree

categories.name: National Security Apparatus
categories.description: Independence and professionalism of security institutions

rubric.1-2: Apolitical security services, normal oversight functioning
rubric.3-4: Increased political pressure on agencies, leadership changes post-election
rubric.5-6: Intelligence weaponized for political purposes, loyalty tests emerging
rubric.7-8: Security services actively targeting political opponents
rubric.9-10: Military or intelligence used for domestic political suppression

categories.name: Regulatory Stability
categories.description: Predictability of regulatory environment, policy consistency

rubric.1-2: Stable regulatory environment, predictable policy changes
rubric.3-4: Increased regulatory uncertainty, more frequent policy reversals
rubric.7-8: Arbitrary enforcement, regulations used punitively against sectors
rubric.9-10: Complete regulatory chaos, rule by fiat

categories.name: Trade & Economic Policy
categories.description: Trade agreements, tariff stability, economic nationalism

rubric.1-2: Stable trade relationships, predictable economic policy
rubric.5-6: Significant tariff actions, supply chain disruptions
rubric.9-10: Complete withdrawal from global economic system

categories.name: Government Contracts & Procurement
categories.description: Fair contracting, political favoritism, procurement integrity

rubric.3-4: Concerns about political favoritism, some no-bid contracts
rubric.5-6: Systematic favoritism to political allies, blacklisting critics
rubric.7-8: Contracts contingent on political support, widespread corruption
rubric.9-10: Complete cronyism, state resources distributed to loyalists

categories.name: Fiscal & Monetary Policy
categories.description: Federal Reserve independence, debt sustainability, fiscal responsibility

rubric.1-2: Independent central bank, sustainable fiscal trajectory
rubric.3-4: Political pressure on Fed, elevated but manageable deficits
rubric.5-6: Credible threats to Fed independence, unsustainable fiscal path
rubric.7-8: Fed independence compromised, debt crisis emerging
rubric.9-10: Political control of monetary policy, fiscal collapse

categories.name: Media Freedom
categories.description: Press freedom, journalist safety, information environment

rubric.1-2: Robust press freedom, healthy media ecosystem
rubric.3-4: Increased hostility toward press, some access restrictions
rubric.5-6: Systematic delegitimization of media, credentialing threats
rubric.7-8: Legal harassment of journalists, significant access denials
rubric.9-10: Press actively suppressed, journalists imprisoned or harmed

categories.name: Civil Discourse & Social Cohesion
categories.description: Public discourse quality, social trust, civic engagement

rubric.5-6: Dehumanizing rhetoric normalized, sporadic political violence
rubric.7-8: Political violence increasing, armed groups mobilizing

categories.name: Institutional Integrity
categories.description: Civil service independence, inspector general function, oversight capacity

rubric.1-2: Independent civil service, robust oversight mechanisms
rubric.3-4: Political pressure on civil servants, some oversight weakening
rubric.5-6: Loyalty tests for officials, IGs marginalized
rubric.7-8: Mass purges of career officials, oversight eliminated
rubric.9-10: Complete politicization of government, no independent oversight
